item.title: By: Erika Kanda
item.dc:creator: Erika Kanda
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://lunastationquarterly.com/evolution-film-lucile-hadzihalilovic/#comment-1543">Kayla</a>.
HadÅ¾ihaliloviÄ‡'s first feature film, <em>Innocence </em>(2004), sounds right up your alley. It's in French, has no body horror, and presents a dark fairy tale about growing up. The only downside is that I can't seem to find it streaming anywhere.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Kayla.

HadÅ¾ihaliloviÄ‡’s first feature film, Innocence (2004), sounds right up your alley. It’s in French, has no body horror, and presents a dark fairy tale about growing up. The only downside is that I can’t seem to find it streaming anywhere.

item.title: By: Kayla
item.dc:creator: Kayla
item.description: "Metaphysical coming-of-age", you say??? Don't mind if I do. I'm a bit sensitive to body horror so I'm proceeding with caution but that setting sounds too intriguing. The fact I can practise my French is a bonus. ;)
item.content:encoded: “Metaphysical coming-of-age”, you say??? Don’t mind if I do. I’m a bit sensitive to body horror so I’m proceeding with caution but that setting sounds too intriguing. The fact I can practise my French is a bonus. ðŸ˜‰
